name: Dips Between Two Benches
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing between two benches, with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands grasping the edges of the benches for support.

2. Lower your body down between the benches by bending your elbows and dipping your upper body downwards.

3. Keep your core engaged and your knees slightly bent to maintain balance throughout the exercise.

4. Lower yourself until you are at a 90-degree angle or slightly below, feeling the stretch in your calves and legs.

5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement.

6. Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms and extending your body upwards.
short_summary: Dips Between Two Benches is an effective exercise for strengthening the calf muscles.
